snippet: A range of retailers said their sales last month were better than expected, particularly in the trendy apparel sector, suggesting that shoppers are snapping up spring fashions.
abstract: Thomson Reuters reports retail sales at stores open at least a year rose an average of 4.3 percent in March, compared with March 2011, topping analysts expectations; brisk sales, particularly in the trendy apparel sector, suggest that shoppers are snapping up spring fashions.
lead_paragraph: A range of retailers said their sales last month were better than expected, particularly in the trendy apparel sector, suggesting that shoppers are snapping up spring fashions.

headline.main: Spring, in the Air and on the Racks, Helps Retailers
headline.print_headline: Spring, in the Air and on the Racks, Helps Retailers
